newsitem.title: FRANCE: GdesEaux says 99.2 of bonds converted.
newsitem.headline: GdesEaux says 99.2 of bonds converted.

text.p: Generale des Eaux said in a statement that 99.2 percent of its convertile bonds issues in 1990 had been converted into shares at the end of an early conversion period on July 2.
It said the operation cut its debt by five billion francs ($824.3 million) and increased its equity capital by the same amount by the creation of 7.9 million new shares.
It said it would also save a reimbursement premium of 510 million francs and the six percent coupon payment for 1997, at 305 million francs.

The company said it maintained its goal of cutting debt to 32 billion francs at the end of 1997, from 45 billion in 1996 and 52 billion in 1995). At that date shareholders funds should be 43 billion francs against 33.7 billion in December 1996.
The company said that 1,771,765 bonds had been converted.
